metadata.title: CVE-2011-2518 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low
metadata.description:
The tomoyo_mount_acl function in security/tomoyo/mount.c in the Linuxkernel before 2.6.39.2 calls the kern_path function with arguments takendirectly from a mount system call, which allows local users to cause adenial of service (OOPS) or possibly have unspecified other impact via aNULL value for the device name.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2011-2518` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-3.11.0-12-generic - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.11.0-12-generic-lpae - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-extra-3.11.0-12-generic - 3.11.0-12.19
No subscription required

linux-image-3.4.0-1-goldfish - 3.4.0-1.7
No subscription required

linux-image-3.1.10-8-grouper - 3.1.10-8.28
No subscription required

linux-image-3.0.0-3-maguro - 3.0.0-3.18
No subscription required

linux-image-3.4.0-3-mako - 3.4.0-3.21
No subscription required

linux-image-3.4.0-4-manta - 3.4.0-4.19
No subscription required

linux-image-3.4.0-1-flo - 3.4.0-1.3
No subscription required
